column4: Hey everyone, i recently uninstalled the proprietry Nvidia driver and wish to reinstall it, unfortunately there seem to be some remanent files preventing it from working properly is there a way to remove all of these?
sudo apt-get purge  package name
in xorg.conf  change nvidia for nv
I'm not an expert on nvidia , check the forum
try asking again in half an hour
try looking in the forum for an answer
please donT' use the enter key for punctuation
family channel
no I meant  go and say that in #family
i'd say quite a long time since theres no one in the channel =P
turn on the system monitor and perform the offending proceedure then check the system monitor to see what is eating up al your resources
you can make a shortcut ot a file folder on your ntfs partition
windows won'T realy ext3
windows won'T reald ext3
even with the ext3ifs? that gives windows ext3 support in its shell?

don't use system monitor then ,  open a terminal and type top
